text.p: USCS International,Inc. said Monday it received notification from Tele-Communications, Inc. that a competitive bid had been chosen by affiliates of TCI for a 15-year customer management contract and the purchase of the SUMMITrak assets. SUMMITrak is an in-house customer care and billing system.
"As previously reported, we have been planning for a migration of TCI's U.S. subscribers to the SUMMITrak system," Dr. James Castle, chairman and chief executive officer of USCS, said in a statement.

"TCI's decision will not have an impact on our previously stated long term strategy to grow and diversify our customer and geographic base. We will continue to aggressively pursue business in the worldwide telecommunications market including U.S. cable. In addition, we have been expanding our presence in industries outside of our traditional telecommunications marketplace."
Castle noted that for the six month period ended June 30, 1996, TCI and its affiliates represented approximately 18% of USCS International's total revenues.
"We believe there will be a orderly transition of TCI subscribers over an extended period, thus reducing both the short and long term impact on our company's financial performance," he said.
